required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Alcon® Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device in Japanese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Efficacy and Safety of the EX-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device in Patients With Normal Tension Glaucoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of the Alcon Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device (Ex-PRESS) in Japanese subjects with normal tension glaucoma.

primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). Only one eye contributed to the analysis.

IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye contributed to the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in IOP
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). A more negative percent change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye contributed to the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With IOP Lowering Rate of 20% or More From Baseline up to Month 12
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). Only one eye contributed to the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes Receiving Drug Therapy for Glaucoma Necessary to Maintain the IOP
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). For some subjects, both left and right eyes were targeted for the study, and data from both eyes were analyzed for this safety endpoint, as specified in the protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes Receiving Secondary Surgical Treatment (Including Laser Therapy) Necessary to Maintain the IOP
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). Secondary surgical treatment included needling, laser suture lysis, and conjunctival and scleral flap sutures. For some subjects, both left and right eyes were targeted for the study, and data from both eyes were analyzed for this safety endpoint, as specified in the protocol. An eye may have received more than one procedure.

arm_group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device, Model P50PL, implanted in the anterior chamber of the study eye during glaucoma surgery intended for the lifetime of the patient

intervention.intervention_name: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device, Model P50PL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of normal tension glaucoma.
- Indicated for filtration surgery using Ex-PRESS®.
- Understand and provide Informed Consent.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant, lactating, or planning to be pregnant during the study period.
- Diagnosis of angle closure glaucoma or secondary glaucoma.
- History of glaucoma surgery.
- Ophthalmologic surgery within the past 6 months.
- Difficulty with applanation tonometry measurement.
- Corneal dystrophy.
- Infectious/non-infectious conjunctivitis, keratitis, or uveitis in either eye.
- Severe blepharitis or dry eye.
- History of metal allergy.
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Contact Alcon Japan, Ltd for Trial Locations

link.description: Results from the Novartis Clinical Trial Results Website

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 3 study centers located in Japan.

group.title: Ex-PRESS

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects after use of the investigational device (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: Ex-PRESS
group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device, Model P50PL, implanted in the anterior chamber of the study eye during glaucoma surgery intended for the lifetime of the patient

measure.title: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
measure.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in millimeters of mercury (mmHg). A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage).
measure.population: This analysis population includes all subjects treated with the investigational device, whose test/assessment data after the use of the device were available, having no inclusion/exclusion criteria violation substantially affecting the efficacy evaluation (Intent-to-Treat Analysis Set).

outcome.title: Percentage of Eyes Receiving Secondary Surgical Treatment (Including Laser Therapy) Necessary to Maintain the IOP
outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). Secondary surgical treatment included needling, laser suture lysis, and conjunctival and scleral flap sutures. For some subjects, both left and right eyes were targeted for the study, and data from both eyes were analyzed for this safety endpoint, as specified in the protocol. An eye may have received more than one procedure.

group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device with needling as a secondary surgical treatment

group.title: Ex-PRESS + Laser Suture Lysis
group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device with laser suture lysis as a secondary surgical treatment

group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device with conjunctival suture as a secondary surgical treatment

group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device with scleral flap suture as a secondary surgical treatment

measure.title: Percentage of Eyes Receiving Secondary Surgical Treatment (Including Laser Therapy) Necessary to Maintain the IOP
measure.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. A higher IOP can be a greater risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). Secondary surgical treatment included needling, laser suture lysis, and conjunctival and scleral flap sutures. For some subjects, both left and right eyes were targeted for the study, and data from both eyes were analyzed for this safety endpoint, as specified in the protocol. An eye may have received more than one procedure.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study (up to 15 months). This analysis population includes all subjects/eyes treated with the investigational device (32 subjects/37 eyes). Number at risk is reported in unit "eyes."
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as all undesirable or unintended signs, symptoms or diseases that occur from the start of the filtration surgery using Ex-PRESS®, regardless of the causal relationship with the filtration surgery using Ex-PRESS®. AEs were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: Ex-PRESS
group.description: Ex-PRESS® Glaucoma Filtration Device, Model P50PL, implanted in the anterior chamber of the study eye during glaucoma surgery intended for the lifetime of the patient

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was a single-arm study with filtration surgery using EX-PRESS®. Although target sample size was 45 patients, only 32 patients (37 eyes) were enrolled due to a small number of patients meeting eligibility criteria of the study.
